property.name: include
property.value: Map:Common Data

property.name: description
property.value: Appears in [[Memory mode]] in WME if you haven't picked up Prototype friend in Solstice.

property.name: page
property.value: Memory mode

property.name: description
property.value: After the Prophetbot encounter ends his friend entry collectible appears in WME.

property.name: description
property.value: After the chess game her friend entry collectible appears in WME.

property.name: description
property.value: Appears in [[Memory mode]] in WME if you haven't picked up Prophets wallpaper in Solstice.

property.name: page
property.value: Memory mode

property.name: description
property.value: WME Solstice route exclusive. If you don't pick it up its backup appears in the Outpost in [[Memory mode]].

properties.property:
The metal rod can be combined with the lightblb to ask Niko to break the sun. This freaks Niko out and they refuse.
This unlocks the Chaotic Evil achievement/badge. If Niko hasn't learned you exist Entity shows the default incorrect combination message but you still get the achievement.

property.name: page
property.value: Chaotic Evil

properties.property:
You can use the lightblb on the press machine to ask Niko to put the sun under the press. This freaks Niko out and they refuse. Alternatively you can combine the crowbar you can make here with the lightbulb.
This unlocks the Chaotic Evil achievement/badge.

property.name: page
property.value: Chaotic Evil

properties.property:
If Silver is at home, interacting with her power cell 3 times makes Niko touch it and get shocked against her wishes. Niko blames you and refuses to touch the cell again.
This unlocks the Shock achievement/badge.
Note that if Silver isn't home in New Game Plus Niko treats this power cell like the others and won't try to touch it.

After reactivating the generator if Niko interacts with it one more time they get shocked. This unlocks the Shock achievement/badge.
If you try to interact with it again, Niko refuses to touch it and steps backward.

property.name: description
property.value: Niko is confused by appearing here after a flash of light at the [[starting house]].

properties.property:
After exiting the "train" for the first time, a cutscene shows Niko looking east at a very tall structure on the horizon and puts them here.
After this, the [[fast travel]] tutorial [[note]] is shown on Non-New Game+ runs of 2016 Remake.

Like in the 2014 Release there is the second trigger of the Prophetbot encounter in case you went behind the Outpost building. However that is not possible to do in the 2016 Remake or World Machine Edition making this impossible to interact with without debug or modding.
Every tile with x=33 make [[Prophetbot]] notice Niko. Then Prophetbot will say [Ah!] and move right and then up until Niko is 1 tile away. Then the proper encounter starts.
Due to expanded building being in the way if Niko stands on any tile except the one the marker is on Prophetbot gets stuck and the game softlocks. Unlike 2014 Release version there's also no code to make Prophetbot move down in case you trigger this from below.

property.name: description
property.value: The (26, 23) tile and every tile below make [[Prophetbot]] turn around and notice Niko. The camera will pan if the Prophetbot is off-screen then Prophetbot will say [Ah!] and move down until Niko is on the same horizontal line and then 1 tile left. Then the proper encounter starts.

property.name: description
property.value: After opening the safe and walking back some [[squares]] appear and scare Niko.

properties.property:
A metal chess table covered in dust because Silver hasn't played in a while and the untamed Barrens robots can't play chess anyway.
After recieving the [[amber]], Niko will ask [[Silver]] about repaying her somehow and agrees to play a game of chess.
During the game, Silver opens up a bit about her history, tamed robots and explains that the cause of the sun's death was the decay of the world that won't stop after the sun is restored but completing the pilgrimage is the only option for Niko. She then proceeds to win the game.
After the game the table is no longer dusty and the Silver friend collectible appears in WME.

property.name: description
property.value: Without the [[gas mask]], Niko will quit this area automatically because the air in this area is unbreathable.

property.name: description
property.value: Without the [[gas mask]], Niko will quit this area automatically because the air in this area is unbreathable.

properties.property:
Silver notices the lightbulb and Niko. She's surprised by the fact the messiah is not as tall as she expected and is a cat-looking child. Silver believes the sun can't fix the world but returning it might compel the incomprehensible force of the Tower to send Niko home.
After introduction Silver can open the mineshaft for you.
Due to the fact Silver wanders randomly she can walk past this trigger and get close enough to Niko to be interacted with before introduction. This sequence break is rather pointless because you need to go through the introduction cutscene to progress the game.

If Silver is home, she asks Niko not to touch her back-up power cell. She says the main generator ran out of power less than a week after the old sun died. After that Niko will be able to notice names of owners of power cells written on them.
If the minecart was summoned in the mineshaft in New Game Plus before Silver explained the power cells there's no way to educate Niko unless Solstice route is aborted.
If Silver is not home and hasn't explained the power cells, Niko comments on the fact they don't know what this machine does and that it makes their hair stand up a little.

Roped off mineshaft entrance with a warning sign prohiiting visitors unuthorized by the Head Engineer from entering the mines.
If you have introduced yourself to Silver she will enter the scene to open up the entrance.

Roped off mineshaft entrance with a warning sign prohiiting visitors unuthorized by the Head Engineer from entering the mines.
If you have introduced yourself to Silver and interact with the roped off entrance she will appear here and go towards the side of the entrance Niko is further away from. She then opens up the mines and accompanies your first visit.

By standing close to the edge Niko can see a faint yellow glow in the distance. Silver then tells Niko to stop the safety violation and walks closer. She then explains the mines abandoned after the old sun died and one robot who went back. She says Niko would need a vehicle to proceed. After this Niko can exit the mineshaft.
In the New Game Plus, Niko sees a vision of a robot with a singular yellow eye and Silver walks in closer than usual to check if Niko is ok. She then explains the robot in more detail.
After she mentions that the Author told her everything she knows about the robot the [[strange journal]] starts to glow. It has the insignia of the Author and the fact Niko woke up with it have Silver intrigued. She then proceeds to explain yellow phosphor and shows the [[amber]] to Niko. Silver encourages Niko to read the glowing journal.

The first visit can't end until Niko stands on the edge of the collapsed path to the deeper mines.
After you exit Silver goes home and Niko gets placed at the lookout point.

The vehicle Niko can use to safely proceed into the Mines and onto the Solstice route or to return. Spawned by solving the glowing journal puzzle in the mineshaft in New Game Plus.
After you get into the minecart for the first time Silver starts following you closely behind. Actually, she follows an invisible Silver that keeps her from clipping into minecart graphics. When you're in a minecart and talk to Silver you actually talk to the invisible clone and interactions of the actual Silver are left unused.
You can come back later but with Silvers blocking your way back the only available path is forward.
Moves 2 tiles forward when entered. Niko can't move vertically in a minecart.
If you abort the Solstice route the Entity removes the minecart and you cannot get it back on the same playthrough.

The first time you go to the Deep mines there's an extra hallway map in the way.
It becomes inaccessible without glitches after you reach Deep mines.

Entity stops you to ask you to turn back because you're going out of bounds and putting Niko in danger by pursuing the new path the Author made.
Now if you talk to Silver Niko is distressed and you have an option to turn back and abort the Solstice route. If you turn back the Entity puts Niko at the dismount point in the mineshaft and deletes the minecart preventing you from going back on the same playthrough. Everything is back to the protocol.

Minecart stops here and can be re-entered to go back. Moves 2 tiles forward when entered. Niko can't move vertically in a minecart.
Can be used anytime until it gets covered in squares and the entrance caves in. After that Niko states they cannot use it anymore.

After Prototype meets Silver and forms a plan the Entity remembers the previous playthroughs. It questions why you came back and brought Niko back after beating the game and then chose to follow the "ghost" of the Author, his book.
Then the Entity asks what did Niko learn in the backroom to make them upset. Then it starts to lose its temper and lashes out. A lot of squares appear putting the minecart out of comission and collapsing the way back.
Everyone rushes out to see what is happening. Prototype has another way out in the backroom. He and Silver return to the backroom. They walk through the power cell on their way.

After reaching the end of the tracks one of the terminal reactivates and Silver stays to check it out.
Rowbot gets covered in squares cutting you off from completing the normal route.
This tile later turns into squares to which Niko says they shouldn't get too close.

Silver stays to investingate the "observation room" terminal that reactivated. She figures it runs on a separate power source and its data formats are new or encrypted.
After recieving the [[memory disk]] Silver discovers a lot of video feeds of various Barrens locations from a top-down perspective. She is bothered by the cameras have to be in the air and wants to investigate them when she gets back.

Prototype turns around and recognizes Niko as a messiah by the light in their eyes or by their name if Rue was befriended on a previous New Game Plus run.
Prototype stores his memory on a floppy disk which was intentionally blanked for safety reasons. Prototype gives Niko the disk so they can restore his memory using the terminal in the room.
After the proper introduction to the world Silver enters the room on the side Niko isn't. She recognizes him but he asks her to show him the amber to make sure she is a friend of the Author. If Niko has the amber they show it instead.
He tasks Silver with protecting the Niko because the journey will be extra dangerous. She leaves preparing to exit the mines. Niko tries to ask her about not being real but Prototype asks not to do that and refuses to answer how he knows everything.

After the exit collapses Silver and Prototype go back to this room.
Prototype reveals that there's an emergency exit behind his terminal. He can't move it alone and would rather dig around it than ask Silver.
She decides to push the terminal to the side on her own and goes through the doorway. Prototype calls her a showoff and then follows her.

A new minecart is waiting for Niko in this new tunnel. Silver didn't see it on the camera feeds and Proto asks Niko to hurry up.
Prototype has an invisible clone with inverted color palette in front of him to keep him from clipping into the minecart graphics.

Entity destabilizes and the tunnel collapses and crushes Silver. She yells at Prototype to take Niko and leave her behind. Then squares spawn on top of her and Niko and Prototype run off.
In WME the wallpaper changes to black, the app icons start to visually glitch out and there's now a chance to see a picture of Niko with no pupils in the Gallery.

property.name: description
property.value: Shocked Prototype and Niko won't talk to each other.

property.name: description
property.value: Squares start spawning around Prototype so he gives you the floppy disk with his memories and moves back. Niko runs off alone as squares contunue to spawn.

property.name: description
property.value: If you try to go back, distressed Niko comments on the fact you can't go back.

properties.property:
Niko faces the player to say "And that robot was saying something. That you keep bringing me back."
Can actually be accessed using glitches.

Niko faces the player to say "We've been through all this before, haven't we. How many times?". Then you get to choose 1 of 2 dialogue options.
If you choose "1" Niko says "I see." If you choose "So Many" Niko says "That's a lot of times!"
Can actually be accessed using glitches.

Niko is distressed by demise of Silver and Prototype and struggles to talk. They turn to face the player and say nothing.
Wind ambiance starts.

property.name: description
property.value: Niko faces you to ask if what the Prophetbot 0 told about the world is true. If you say "No." Niko doesn't believe you and regardless of your answer Niko talks about everything adding up.

properties.property:
Trigger for Niko to step on placed Out of Bounds.
Distressed Niko faces you to ask why you didn't tell them anything about the Author and his plan to fix things.

The robot made with a sole purpose of greeting the messiah from the prophecy. Not tamed.
When [[Niko]] gets close, [[Prophetbot]] notices the [[lightbulb]] and approaches Niko, excited to provide the savior with vital information.
Prophetbot can explain (all options except "the computer/about [[player]]" are optional and can be skipped with Cancel key):
1) The history and regions of the [[world]] and the Tower that housed the old sun.
2) The old and new [[sun]]s, the phosphor that stores their energy, and the reliance of the world on light for survival.
3.1) The computer saying the name of the [[player]], who is revealed to be the god of the world. The Prophetbot will teach Niko to communicate with the player directly. This presents an opportunity for the player to change their name. Certain names cause unique reactions from Niko. Prophetbot will also encourage Niko to look for the player's guidance.
3.2)In the [[New Game Plus]] Niko recalls saying the player's name right after waking up and figures out how to contact them without Prophetbot's guidance. Niko will ask the player if they have met you before. This doesn't give you an opportunity to rename. In the 2016 Remake only you have to exahaust every dialogue option in order to make Prophetbot let you go.
4) Prophetbot doesn't know how Niko can go home, but their mission is to save the world.
After answering the questions Prophetbot wishes Niko luck and starts wandering aimlessly. This also spawns him friend entry collectible in WME.
If you talk to Prophetbot again he can explain the Barrens, the prophecy and the Tower. After you recieve the [[amber]] you can say goodbye to him and thank him for help.

The Barrens' head engineer, that stayed when everyone else left the Barrens.
She has the [[amber]] neccessary to make the [[Rowbot]] remember the way to the [[Glen]].
Can explain the history of the [[Tower]] and speculate that the force inside it is the Niko's way to return home.
She will try to read the [[strange journal]] if you give it to her but she can't. Dialogue changes in New Game Plus if she saw the journal glowing but Niko left the mineshaft.
Moves to the mineshaft if the minecart is summoned and moves back if the Solstice route is aborted. She cannot give [[amber]] while at the mineshaft and if she moves into the Deeper mines the Solstice route can no longer be aborted.

The [[Entity]] comments on the fact this a robot with no power. After [[Prophetbot]] makes [[Niko]] familiar with the [[Player]], Niko comments instead.
The robot becomes powered after Outpost generator is reactivated. When powered, the robot wanders aimlessly and states that it is functional.

property.name: description
property.value: A robot that becomes powered after Outpost generator is reactivated. When powered, the robot continuously walks 5 tiles right, looks up and then returns back in its default position. Also states that it is functional and can walk.

property.name: description
property.value: A robot that becomes powered after Outpost generator is reactivated. When powered, the robot continues to sit on the floor. It also states that it is functional and asks Niko if they did power the generator.

property.name: description
property.value: A robot that becomes powered after Outpost generator is reactivated. When powered, the robot continuously walks 5 tiles right, looks up and then returns back in its default position. Also greets Niko and calls them an "organic life form".

properties.property: A robot that becomes powered after Outpost generator is reactivated. When powered, the robot continues to sit on the conveyor belt. It also says hi to Niko and states that it has power again.
A robot that becomes powered after Outpost generator is reactivated. When powered, the robot continues to sit on the conveyor belt. It also says hello to Niko.

A robot that becomes powered after Outpost generator is reactivated. When powered, the robot stands up and starts looking north. It calls Niko a small pesron and introduces you to the lookout point and the quarry. He also points out the head engineer and the mines entrance are located further east.
Its internal name is "garden".

The robot becomes powered after Outpost generator is reactivated. When powered, the robot wanders aimlessly. It also greets Niko and states that robot assembly and repair services have been discontinued at the Barrens so if they need something they should contact the Head Engineer.
Unpowered version has no interactions and is inaccessible on the current patch.

The robot becomes powered after Outpost generator is reactivated. When powered, the robot wanders aimlessly. It welcomes them into the old chemical processing plant and states that most of the equipment has been already relocated.
Unpowered version has no interactions and is inaccessible on the current patch.

property.name: description
property.value: A robot sitring on the edge. It states that the sky is dark and asks Niko when the sun will be back up.

properties.property:
Giant robot guarding what remains of the the residential area. Was left behind to guard an empty settlement because it is not tamed. Badly damaged, Blue Guardian constantly turns on and off and emits sparks from the left side of its body.
It suggests that Niko should evacuate or talk to the Prophetbot who was built with the sole purpose of greeting the messiah and is incapable to speak with anyone else.
After talking to the Guardian once, the robot on the left side of building 119 in the area starts following Niko but the guardian says to not be alarmed by robot followers as they only want to ensure safety.

property.name: page
property.value: Blue Guardian

properties.property:
A robot standing in place asking if Niko needs any help.
After Niko talks to the Blue Guardian this robot starts to follow Niko outdoors. Introduces itself and activates the second follower after walking into Niko for the first time.

A robot standing in place asking if Niko needs any help.
After UNIT RM-2883417 introduces itself, this robot starts to follow Niko outdoors even though Niko already has an escort. Introduces itself after walking into Niko for the first time.

object.name: Robot that is supposed to walk in circles

properties.property:
A robot that greets Niko and points towards the infirmary.
It's supposed to walk in circles in front of the infirmary door, but in the 2016 Remake it walks into the big pool and gets permanently stuck. Its route was fixed in WME.

property.name: description
property.value: A robot that weclomes Niko to the Infirmary and scans them for injuries. After detecting none it says Niko is good to go.

properties.property:
A robot sitting at the table and playing with some sort of rubbery tape. It asks Niko if they seek admission into the Infirmary.
In WME it has weird phisics and pulls Niko to the middle of the table if you walk into it.

property.name: description
property.value: A robot that continuously walks bac and forth 6 tiles right and then 6 tiles left. It constantly checks the broken terminals and finds the fact they don't respond a problem

property.name: description
property.value: The robot states that all terminals don't boot and that it is unsure what to do.

properties.property:
Prophetbot's predecessor, a tamed robot from the [[Old World]] waiting for a second chance to see a messiah.
Prototype stores his memory on a floppy disk which was intentionally blanked for safety reasons. He can eject/insert it using a drive on his head.
After his memory is restored he reveals the truth about the Old and the simulated worlds, the player and the goals and stakes of the solstice route. Niko remembers previous playthroughs and becomes very upset. From now on after you reload the game Niko reaction is silence.
Prototype instructs Niko to reach the Glen via Rowbot or finding a new boat and then stops talking to contact Cedric or Rue.
After meeting Silver and exit collapsing he reveals the emergency exit behind his terminal but he can't move it alone so you'll have to ask Silver to do it.

The camera pans up and down if you interact with the wall, revealing the full height and a robot sitting on it.
If the robot is visible Niko asks it what it's doing and the robot answers that it's stationed here by itself. The part of the wall with the robot can be triggered by walking into it.
The robot's internal name is "friend".

A safe locked with a random 6 digit code which could be anything from 100000 to 999999. To get the code you need to use the computer in the Outpost. The code is not generated until you do, so blindly bruteforcing it is impossible.
The safe contains the [[gas mask]] and the [[strange journal]]. With the gas mask, Niko can explore the natural gas vent zones, the Swamp and Old factory. The journal has no relevance until [[Glen]] but you can show it to [[Silver]].
In the [[New Game Plus]] the safe contains only the gas mask.

property.name: description
property.value: A big industrial machine with a rectangular hole in the middle. Can be reactivated using the [[charged battery]] to power a lot of machinery and robots across the Barrens.

properties.property:
In the New Game Plus, a clover appears here. It marks the correct tile to stand on to summon the minecart with the glowing journal.
After seeing the minecart Silver stays in the mineshaft leaving her home and stopping being able to give Niko the [[amber]] unless you abort the Solstice route. If you summoned the minecart but Silver has left Niko goes to find her off-screen.
Both are confused by the minecart appearance because nobody was looking but Silver rationalizes it by assuming a minecart has detected motion and sent itself over.

The second floor door is boarded up and the [[crowbar]] is needed to unblock it.
There's an interaction for the metal pipe but it's inacessible on the current patch.

The Prophetbot 0 backup system terminal requires you to configure the Residential tracking machine so it is up to date.
There are 6 buttons, one for each Dormitory building and 3 symbols to describe what is inside the buildings. The game expects you to take the minecart back and replaying the game until reaching the Dormitories. However, you can save the blue [[charged battery]] by not revisiting the Dormitories and use it to progress the story.
You can do an extra action after the last button press because the solution check is delayed.
The solution is always the same:
110 has a robot beyond repair = Robot
117 has nothing but letter = Empty
112 is the infirmary with medical robots = Cross
118 has a robot sitting on the capsule wall = Robot
113 has nothing but a note and a jar of shrimp = Empty
119 has the power cell of the Blue Guardian = Electricity

A PC with a blue screen that turns on after Outpost generator is reactivated. It congratulates you on your progress and asks you to look into the Documents folder for the "DOCUMENT.oneshot.txt" file containing the 6 digit code of the safe in the Cliffs. After the safe is opened the computer turns back off.
In the New Game Plus the document is drastically shorter because it doesnt contain a corrupted letter from the Author explaining the safe and its location and contents.
Interacting with the computer if required to open the safe because the code is not even generated until you talk to the PC. The default code value is 0 and the safe is coded to ignore 0.

<poem>''1. A robot may not ''injure a living person ''or, through inaction, ''allow a person to come ''to harm.
''2. A robot must obey ''the orders given to it ''by people, except where ''such orders would ''conflict with the First ''Law.
''3. A robot must protect ''its own existence as ''long as such protection ''does not conflict with ''the First or Second ''Law.</poem>

property.name: description
property.value: [[file:cg map.png]]

properties.property:
<poem>Niko comments on this poster being faded.
''REMINDER TO ALL ''WORKERS:
''The rarest form of ''blue phosphor is found ''during the phosphor ''shrimp's spawn period.
''If you observe a pond ''with a bubbled-over ''surface, please contact ''management immediately!
''We will dispatch a ''harvest team ASAP.</poem>

<poem>Niko comments on this poster being faded.
''Five new positions ''available at the mines.
''Housing and other ''provisions are included ''upon hiring.
''First come, first serve.</poem>

Niko comments on the fact they don't know what this machine does and that it makes their hair stand up a little.
Niko is able to understand that this is the [[Prophetbot]]'s power cell after inspecting the similar power cell at the [[Silver]]'s cabin while she's home.

<poem>''REVOLUTIONARY! ''SELF-CHARGING SOLAR ''BATTERY MODEL N-87 ''(One year warranty ''included)
''Simply place your ''self-charging battery ''in full daylight with ''the lens facing up.
''Charges in seconds, no ''external power is ''needed.
''TROUBLESHOOTING MANUAL.
''If the battery fails to ''charge, check to see if ''the lens on the front ''side has not been ''dislodged during ''transport.
''One charge cycle will ''last about ten days.
''If you notice a decline ''in the charge cycle ''within the warranty ''period, please contact ''the manufacturer.</poem>

<poem>''The use of a robot as ''our replacement head ''engineer seems ''unorthodox.
''...especially the one ''responsible for last ''year's incident.
''I suppose they had to ''get her away from the ''city, but that doesn't ''make it easier to ''swallow for those of us ''who work here!
''I hope that man knows ''what he's doing.
''--Management</poem>

The [[Entity]] comments on the horizon glowing a faint green. After [[Prophetbot]] makes [[Niko]] familiar with the [[Player]], Niko comments instead.
Can actually be accessed using glitches.

property.name: description
property.value: The [[Entity]] comments on the horizon glowing a faint green. After [[Prophetbot]] makes [[Niko]] familiar with the [[Player]], Niko comments instead.

property.name: description
property.value: The [[Entity]] comments on the horizon glowing a faint green. After [[Prophetbot]] makes [[Niko]] familiar with the [[Player]], Niko comments instead.

property.name: description
property.value: The [[Entity]] comments on the horizon glowing a faint green. After [[Prophetbot]] makes [[Niko]] familiar with the [[Player]], Niko comments instead.

property.name: description
property.value: The [[Entity]] comments on the horizon glowing a faint green. After [[Prophetbot]] makes [[Niko]] familiar with the [[Player]], Niko comments instead.

property.name: description
property.value: The [[Entity]] comments on the horizon glowing a faint green. After [[Prophetbot]] makes [[Niko]] familiar with the [[Player]], Niko comments instead.

property.name: description
property.value: The [[Entity]] comments on the horizon glowing a faint green. After [[Prophetbot]] makes [[Niko]] familiar with the [[Player]], Niko comments instead.

properties.property:
The [[Entity]] comments on the horizon glowing a faint green. After [[Prophetbot]] makes [[Niko]] familiar with the [[Player]], Niko comments instead.
Can actually be accessed using glitches.

Niko comments on lots of tiny glowing shrimp swimming in this jar and that a lot of them are not glowing or moving.
If Silver is home, she's shocked because the jar she refilled two days ago needs to be replaced already. She says she will go to the shore later and that the jars don't last very long.

property.name: description
property.value: Niko comments on this being a jar full of glowing shrimp covered with a wire mesh at the top.

property.name: description
property.value: Niko comments on this being a jar full of glowing shrimp covered with a wire mesh at the top.

property.name: description
property.value: Niko comments on lots of tiny glowing shrimp swimming in this jar.

properties.property:
<poem>''Dear Silver,
''I heard the news about ''the mines.
''I'm sorry... I can't ''imagine what you're ''feeling.
''It's been two weeks...
''I know it must be hard, ''but maybe it's better ''that you came back...
''It's only a matter of ''time before the rowbots ''are recalled.
''At least let me know ''you got my message, ''okay?
''-Kip</poem>

<poem>''The amount of noxious fumes emitted by the ''natural gas vents caught our team off-guard. ''With such a high concentration, it seemed ''impossible that anything with lungs could exist.
''It remained quite a mystery until our ''scientists realized the shrimp scattered ''in the pools were actually consuming it.
''Without those shrimp, life wouldn't be. ''It's kind of depressing to think that we ''can't thank them.
''Still, we wore masks to be safe, especially ''around active vent sites. ''The replacement of our workforce by robots ''soon rendered masks unecessary.
''I wonder what happened to them all? ''I can't even remember where I placed mine.</poem>

property.name: description
property.value: The [[Entity]] comments on the fact those are robot remains. After [[Prophetbot]] makes [[Niko]] familiar with the [[Player]], Niko comments instead.

properties.property:
<poem>''The sun will not return ''and the abyss is calling ''my name.
''I'm sorry, everyone...
''...for choosing to leave ''before the darkness ''suffocates us all.
Niko comments on this by staying silent.</poem>

<poem>''There's something weird ''about the robots who ''get sent to work near ''the gas fields.
''They appear to ''accumulate rust at a ''much slower rate than ''the others.
''The few who work ''directly with gas ''harvesting look ''practically new!
''Is that a result of the ''atmosphere? Or am I ''just seeing things?</poem>

<poem>''Hey sweetie,
''Six more weeks until ''you can come home!
''<nowiki>'</nowiki>bout time, huh?
''Gosh, I can't imagine ''living in that awful ''capsule wall...dorm... ''thing!
''But guess what? Soon ''you'll get to sleep in a ''real bed and eat real ''food again!
''Write back soon!
''-love, mom.
Niko then says "Aww..."</poem>

<poem>''I remember being taught ''in school about how the ''waters surrounding the ''forest stretched until ''the boundries of space.
''But at some point, the ''prehistoric oceans ''receded, forming what ''is now the Barrens.
''I wonder where all that ''water went...</poem>

<poem>Niko comments on this likely being a page ripped from a book.
''-cannot overstate the ''importance of cleaning ''solvents in this ''environment.
''Here is a simple recipe ''using the alternative ''method discussed in the ''last chapter, utilizing ''the natural properties ''of blue phosphor.
''Reagents:
''-Acidic gas
''-Blue phosphor (rare form)
''Instructions:
''1) In a well-ventilated ''area, direct the gas ''into your container of ''choice.
''Seal immediately.
Niko comments on this being the end of the page.</poem>

property.name: page
property.value: Bottle of acid

property.name: description
property.value: The [[Entity]] comments on the fact those are robot remains. After [[Prophetbot]] makes [[Niko]] familiar with the [[Player]], Niko comments instead.

property.name: description
property.value: The [[Entity]] comments on the fact those are robot remains. After [[Prophetbot]] makes [[Niko]] familiar with the [[Player]], Niko comments instead.

property.name: description

property.name: description

properties.property:
<poem>Niko comments on this being a page with faded ink.
''-able to provide power ''to all robots and ''machinery in the area ''via a large ''electromagnetic field.
''Maintenance efforts are ''quite high, as expected.
''We have provided ''customized backup cells ''for the few most ''important robots.
''Their electromagnetic ''fields are much weaker, ''and the signals are ''highly specific.
''In other words, these ''small cells can only ''charge one single-
Niko comments on the rest of the page being unreadable.</poem>

<poem>''Although the poisonous ''gas is highly localized ''to the vent zones, ''Barrens workers were ''still recommended to ''wear gas masks.
''These masks were ''mandatory around active ''vent sites, of course.
''As more and more of ''the workforce got ''replaced by robots, we ''found ourselves with a ''surplus of abandoned ''gas masks.
''It seemed like a waste ''to get rid of them all, ''so we kept a few for ''emergencies.</poem>

<poem>Niko comments on this being a torn page with faded ink.
''XX/XX/XX
''With the mining ''operations going ''smoothly, materials are ''no longer our limiting ''factor.
''We will be able to build ''more resilient robots, ''both in body and mind.
''Specifically, the ''discovery of metal alloy ''291 will likely allow the ''development of highly ''efficient circuitry.</poem>

Niko comments on the fact this is a gas vent. If the empty bottle or bottle of pond water is used Niko states they can't reach the top of the vent.
The interaction is slightly delayed so you can do an extra action before the text appears. Can actually be accessed using glitches.

properties.property:
<poem>Niko comments on this likely being a page ripped from a book.
''2) Without breaking the ''seal, inject the liquid ''phosphor into the ''container.
''3) Shake vigorously to ''initiate the reaction.
''4) Use as soon as ''possible.
''Note: If elements begin ''to separate, further ''shaking is required.
''Also note: Hand ''protection is critical ''after this step.
''The resulting acid is ''moderately stronger ''than common household ''cleaners.
Niko comments on the fact they don't understnad half of the words and express relief because you're here.</poem>

property.name: page
property.value: Bottle of acid

property.name: description
property.value: The camera pans up and down, then Niko admits to be scared of ladders. This event can be triggered by walking into it.

properties.property:
<poem>''Looks like we're ''supposed to pack stuff ''for the evacuation ''starting today...
''I wish these books ''weren't so heavy...it's ''gonna be a pain to ''carry them onto the ''ship.
''But they're by the ''Author! I can't just ''throw them away!</poem>

property.name: description
property.value: The camera pans up and down if you interact with the wall, revealing the full height.

property.name: description
property.value: The camera pans up and down if you interact with the wall, revealing the full height.

property.name: description
property.value: 2 wall triggers Out of Bounds that make Niko move right or left and then face up before triggering the wall camera pan.

properties.property:
A picture of a robot. Makes Niko talk about never seeing a robot outside cartoons before entering the world.
You can ask Niko to do a robot voice and they will say that they eat batteries because they are a robot using the robotic text sound. This makes the robot on the wall turn around and correct Niko about robots not having mouths or digestive systems. Niko doesn't like you making them look silly.

property.name: description
property.value: The camera pans up and down if you interact with the wall, revealing the full height.

property.name: description
property.value: The camera pans up and down, then Niko admits to be scared of ladders. This event can be triggered by walking into it.

property.name: description
property.value: Niko comments on tiny shrimp swimming in this jar.

property.name: description
property.value: A wall trigger, same as the others in the room, but Out of Bounds and inaccessible.

property.name: description
property.value: The camera pans up and down if you interact with the wall, revealing the full height.

property.name: description
property.value: The camera pans up and down, then Niko admits to be scared of ladders. This event can be triggered by walking into it.

properties.property:
<poem>''Apparently, phase 1 of ''the evacuation ended ''prematurely.
''The big ships started ''malfunctioning only ''after a few round ''trips.
''They said it was due ''to... something with ''squares?
''I'm not sure what they ''mean by that.
''Bummer, looks like they ''won't be able to ''transport most of ''these surplus bots to ''the city at this rate.
''And we worked so hard ''on those!
''But I suppose the ''rowbots are busy ''enough with ''transporting people as ''is.
''I think it's going to be ''our turn soon...</poem>

<poem>''Looks like they're ''evacuating the few ''tamed robots we have ''here.
''Makes sense... no point ''in keeping them in the ''Barrens if all the ''people are already gone.
''I wonder if the ''engineer is going too...</poem>

Niko comments on the fact they don't know what this machine does and that it makes their hair stand up a little.
Niko is able to understand that this is the power cell of the "Guardian of Residential Area" after inspecting the similar power cell at the [[Silver]]'s cabin while she's home.

property.name: description
property.value: Niko comments on lots of tiny shrimp swimming in this jar and that it looks a little dim.

property.name: description
property.value: The camera pans up and down if you interact with the wall, revealing the full height.

property.name: description
property.value: The camera pans up and down, then Niko admits to be scared of ladders. This event can be triggered by walking into it.

property.name: description
property.value: Niko comments on the fact this a robot beyond repair.

property.name: description
property.value: Niko comments on this being some sort of mechanical drawing.

properties.property:
<poem>''Evacuation? At such ''short notice?
''I can't believe this...
''First the sun dies, now ''I'm out of a job...</poem>

property.name: description
property.value: Niko more confidently assumes that these are computers.

property.name: description
property.value: Niko more confidently assumes that these are computers.

properties.property:
<poem>Niko comments on the fact some ink on this page is faded.
''-likely due some sort ''of electrical or ''magnetic interference.
''I'm afraid this ''operation can no longer ''be sustained, if the ''servers continue to ''fail so much that ''maintenance cannot keep ''up the pace.
''Fortunately, it does ''not seem to be ''happening to the ''robots.
''At least, not at a ''significant rate.
''Time will tell.</poem>

property.name: description
property.value: Says "INFIRMARY".

property.name: description
property.value: Says "INFIRMARY".

properties.property:
Niko comments on the fact they don't know what this machine does and that it makes their hair stand up a little.
Niko is able to understand that this is the power cell of the "Prophetbot" after inspecting the similar power cell at the [[Silver]]'s cabin while she's home.
One of the Prototype's aliases is Prophetbot 0 because he's the predecessor of the Prophetbot found at the Outpost.

property.name: description
property.value: Niko comments on the fact these are computers.

property.name: description
property.value: Niko comments on the fact these are computers.

property.name: description
property.value: Niko comments on a lot of small, glowing shrimp swimming in the jar.

properties.property:
<poem>''RESIDENTIAL TRACKING ''MACHINE
''For reference, an ''explanation of the ''symbols:
''Cross: Medical Units are ''assigned to this ''building.
''Robot: A robot is ''assigned to this ''building.
''Electricity: A power cell ''is assigned to this ''building.</poem>

property.name: description
property.value: This tile later turns into squares to which Niko says they shouldn't get too close.

properties.property:
This tile later turns into squares to which Niko says they shouldn't get too close.
Can actually be accessed using glitches.

A small blue glimmer shines on a shelf. It is a screwdriver that can be combined with the [[camera]] to get the [[lens]] out of it.
If Silver is home, she says she has many screwdrivers so Niko can take one if they want.

property.name: description
property.value: A locked box with a small flickering sun symbol on its side. Contains a broken solar battery. Can be opened using the [[crowbar]].

property.name: page
property.value: Broken battery

property.name: description
property.value: A metal rod is found here. It can be used on the active press machine in the Outpost factory to make the [[crowbar]].

property.name: page
property.value: Metal rod

property.name: description
property.value: A cleaning sponge is found here. It can be combined with the [[bottle of acid]] to make the [[wet sponge]] if you have the [[rubber gloves]].

properties.property:
A pond with a bubble and full of rare organic form of blue phosphor. The thick liquid inside can be used to make the cleaning solution recipe described on the pages inside the [[Old factory]]. You can fill the [[empty syringe]] with pond water to make the filled syringe which can be combined with the [[bottle of smoke]] to make the [[bottle of acid]].
If bottle of smoke is used on it Niko empties it. If the empty bottle is used on it Niko tells a story.

property.name: page
property.value: Viscous syringe

property.name: description
property.value: A pair of rubber gloves is found here. They are required to combine the [[sponge]] with the [[bottle of acid]] and use the resulting [[wet sponge]] to clean the [[Rowbot]].

property.name: page
property.value: Rubber gloves

properties.property:
A big press machine active even without the generator. It constantly rectracts and extends the press as if trying to crush something and produces banging noises heard throughout the entire building.
Can be used to turn the [[metal rod]] into a [[crowbar]] which can be used to open the box inside the Outpost and to unblock the second floor passage of the Old factory.

A broken camera is found here. It can be combined with the [[screwdriver]] to get the [[lens]].
Silver speculates that it might be a robot part, but she doesn't know for sure.

property.name: description
property.value: A first aid kit containing broken and rusted medical tools. Niko will take a plastic [[empty syringe]] from it and the box will disappear. The syringe can be filled with blue phosphor liquid of the [[shrimp swamp]] bubble pond to get the [[filled syringe]].

property.name: page
property.value: Empty syringe

property.name: description
property.value: A small acidic gas vent Niko can reach. The [[empty bottle]] or the bottle of pond water can be filled with the gas here to make the [[bottle of smoke]] for the cleaning solution recipe described on the pages inside the [[Old factory]].

property.name: page
property.value: Bottle of smoke

property.name: description
property.value: Niko comments on the shelf having weird tools and pieces of metal.

property.name: description
property.value: Niko comments on the shelf having weird tools and pieces of metal.

properties.property:
The Prophetbot 0 backup system terminal can write the Prototype's backup to the disk after the tracking puzzle is solved.
It's also positioned to block the emergency exit. It's weighed down so it can't be moved by anyone but Silver.

Rowbot #310, unpowered, rusty and circuits fried. Needs to be powered by the [[Outpost]] generator, cleand with the [[wet sponge]] and reminded where the [[Glen]] is with the [[amber]] to be able to transport Niko there. Until Niko uses the bed they're too sleepy to proceed.
When the Rowbot is unpowered you get an opportunity to prank Niko by saying you're not here.
On the Solstice route the Rowbot gets covered in squares and asks Niko to not approach it. If it's unpowered Niko comments on the squares.

property.name: description

property.name: description
property.value: This tile triggers fade-to-black "outdoors transition" to the extra hallway/server room map. It switches destinations after the [[Entity]] asks Niko to turn back.

properties.property:
This tile triggers fade-to-black "outdoors transition" to the mineshaft map.
If the Silver is following you she blocks it before you can use it.

Niko faces the player to say "That robot told me to try and remember, so I will. Sleepy time.".
Niko's sprite changes to unique set of sprites with eyes closed while in the blue minecart. No cutscene happens and Niko appears in the Glen mines as normal. Except still in the blue minecart and with closed eyes.
Can actually be accessed using glitches.

Niko turns to fce the player and starts worrying about the chance of them not being able to fix the world and return home. They don't know what to do.
Niko sits down in the minecart and closes their eyes. The camera zooms out until Niko is just a glowing dot on a purple line.
Screen fades to black to the end of the tracks in the Glen.

Shrimp swamp in the 2016 Remake, Swamp in the World Machine Edition.
Gas mask is reqiured to unlock this fast travel point.

property.name: description
property.value: Not unlocked until after the [[Prophetbot]] encounter.

property.name: description
property.value: Gas mask is reqiured to unlock this fast travel point.

properties.property:
Allows Niko to rest and dream. Meeting the [[Prophetbot]] is required to use this bed. Using this bed is required to leave the Barrens.
After the first time sleeping in this bed Niko will have a dream about the wheat field surrounding their home village. Niko will be excited to tell you more about their home and will ask you about yours.
On the Solstice route, Niko doesn't see dreams and can use beds more than once although it's no longer required for anything.

This tile triggers fade-to-black "outdoors transition" to the server room map.
After this point there is no way to terminate the Solstice route. After Silver moves into the server room squares spawn on top of the [[Rowbot]] making the normal route impossible to complete.

Niko can't use the bed more than once on the normal route, meaning if you're going for the "Oneshot" [[achievement]] you wont have more opportunities to quit the game in the Barrens.
On the Solstice route you can use beds multiple times but you can't earn the achievement.
